intro: Peristylus gigas, commonly known as the giant peristylus, is a striking member of the Arecaceae family, native to the tropical regions of South America. This towering palm can reach heights of up to 20 meters, featuring a slender trunk wrapped in a fibrous sheath. Its large, pinnate leaves are often used in traditional medicine and basket weaving by local communities. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that develop into edible, black drupes. Due to habitat loss, Peristylus gigas is now considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
